data.title: Washington State University
data.text:
First Gen Law: What you need to know

JB Kim, Director of Diversity at Lewis and Clark Law School will discuss navigating law school as a first generation law student. Any and all questions welcome. Lunch provided. » More ...

Become A Lawyer Without Law School?!

A panel of experts will share the alternative path to becoming a lawyer in Washington via an apprenticeship. The Law Clerk Program is a four-year program designed to provide educational and practical experience through a combination of work and study with an experienced lawyer or judge. Come find out more about this less costly alternative to practicing law! » More ...

Meet with Jeffrey Dodge, Associate Dean for University of Idaho Law

Stop by and chat with Associate Dean Jeffrey Dodge from UI College of Law on Valentine's Day. Find out more about law school, law practice, or UI Law. Ask all your questions! » More ...

Finding a Law School That Fits You – Susan Lee, Gonzaga Law

Susan Lee, Admissions Director for Gonzaga University School of Law will provide insight on finding a law school that is a good fit for you, including what to consider and how to effectively communicate with law admissions offices.

Susan will also be taking individual 20-minute appointments with WSU students from 12-3. Call the PLRC to schedule: 509-335-2325.

Would You be a Happy Lawyer? – Carole Wells, UI Law

Carole Wells, Admission Director for the University of Idaho College of Law will delve into the ins and outs of law school and legal careers to help you assess whether a legal career is a good fit for you. She will also provide more information on UI Law and its admission process.
